Pilot: Safe System Approach for Children’s Active Travel in Peri-Urban Areas (Pilot 1)
Description: In the neighbourhood of Bergum Gunnilse key mobility challenges concern insufficient lighting and a lack of pedestrian and bicycle paths as a consequence, many prefer to move around by car.
name: Gothenburg (pilot 1)

Pilot: Harnessing Digitalization to Foster Safe and Sustainable Solutions in Transformative Urban Mobility (Pilot 2)
Description: Gothenburg leverages its digitalisation capabilities and data resources to proactively improve sustainable transportation, traffic safety and enhance accessibility in a city undergoing major transformation.
name: Gothenburg (pilot 2)

Pilot: Regional Commuter Plan for Climate Neutrality (Pilot 1)
Description: The first SSML intervention in Heidelberg is about a regional commuter plan for climate neutrality. To measure the impacts, Heidelberg’s new traffic model, numerous traffic counting stations and parking observatory will aid the implementation.
name: Heidelberg (pilot 1)

Description: In Heidelberg, homezone streets often fall short of expected standards for safety and vibrancy. The initiative utilises tactical elements like parklets and green infrastructure, along with adaptive land use strategies, to enhance the public quality of streets across diverse urban contexts.
UMI Categories: Modal Share, Access to Mobility Services, Space Reallocation
name: Heidelberg (pilot 2)

Pilot: Pedestrians, Cyclists & MMV in Shared Spaces (Pilot 1)
Thematic Clasters: Concepts for Space Reallocation, Integrated Traffic Reorganization
Description: Barcelona’s first SSML studies factors affecting interactions between pedestrians, cyclists, and Micromobility Vehicles (MMV) in shared spaces like pedestrian priority streets or squares. It diagnoses conflicts and proposes solutions.
UMI Categories: Accidents & Injuries, Modal Share, Space Reallocation
name: Barcelona (pilot 1)
location: Carrer Consell de Cent, Open Streets, Parc de les Glòries

Pilot: Increased and Integrated Public Transport Accessibility System for People with Disabilities (Pilot 2)
Thematic Clasters: Integrated Traffic Reorganization, Concepts for Space Reallocation
Description: Barcelona has a public door to door service for people with reduced mobility operating with a fleet of buses and taxis, providing programmed and sporadic journeys. However, the existing fleet struggles to meet the high demand for the service.
UMI Categories: Modal Share, Access to Mobility Services
name: Barcelona (pilot 2)

Pilot: Improving Traffic Safety in Budapest's Peri-urban Areas (Pilot 1)
Description: In harmony with the upcoming Cycle Traffic Network Plan, the SSML will focus on traffic calming and modal shift that can be used in the periurban stress points of the city, to create safer and more controlled intersections.
UMI Categories: Accidents & Injuries, Modal Share, Access to Mobility Services
name: Budapest (pilot 1)

Thematic Clasters: Concepts for Space Reallocation, Central Areas Traffic Reorganization, Integrated Traffic Reorganization
Impact Areas: Road Safety, Environmental, Transformative Governance, Inclusivity/Accessibility
Description: The second SSML in Budapest draws inspiration from London’s healthy streets and Barcelona’s super-blocks, emphasising traffic calming interventions with a preference for public transport and active mobility modes.
name: Budapest (pilot 2)

Pilot: Public Space Redesigning and Enhancing Road Safety in the Schools’ Surroundings (Pilot 1)
Thematic Clasters: Safe & Sustainable Schools, Concepts for Space Reallocation
Impact Areas: Road Safety, Environmental, Transformative Governance, Inclusivity/Accessibility
Description: This initiative integrates a comprehensive qualitative and quantitative assessment, encompassing speed measurements, pedestrian, cyclist, and e-scooter counts, with the development of mobility plans for schools and targeted college interventions.
UMI Categories: GHG Emissions, Congestion, Accidents & Injuries, Modal Share, Air Pollution, Noise Pollution, Access to Mobility Services
name: Lyon (pilot 1)

Pilot: Road Safety Tech & Non-Pollution Parking Policy (Pilot 2)
Thematic Clasters: Integrated Traffic Reorganization, Central Areas Traffic Reorganization, Data Safety Digital Integration, Concepts for Space Reallocation
Description: Lyon faces challenges such as road safety issues and pollution due to high motorised traffic levels. To address these, the city plans to manage traffic volumes, and discourage heavy vehicle usage through parking policies based on vehicle attributes.
UMI Categories: Congestion, Modal Share, Air Pollution, Noise Pollution
name: Lyon (pilot 2)

Pilot: Neutral, Safe, and Sustainable School District along the Knowledge Path Interventions and Indicators
Thematic Clasters: Concepts for Space Reallocation, Data Safety Digital Integration, Integrated Traffic Reorganization, Central Areas Traffic Reorganization
Description: The aim of Bologna’s SSML is to implement the public space of the school district in collaboration with the school, students and local stakeholders in order to make it neutral and comfortable to encourage a sustainable, safe and autonomous daily home-school mobility.
name: Bologna
location: Via Erbosa, Via Gobetti, Via Cristoforo da Bologna, via Manin - along the Via della Conoscenza, Quartiere Navile

Thematic Clasters: Safe & Sustainable Schools, Integrated Traffic Reorganization
Description: The SSML addresses community needs by improving traffic management, reducing pollution, and promoting sustainable transportation for enhanced safety and air quality. It focuses on fostering active mobility and safe transportation for residents.
UMI Categories: Modal Share, Air Pollution, Noise Pollution, Accidents & Injuries
name: Utrecht

Pilot: AI for Increased Road Safety, Space Reallocation & Parametric Design
Thematic Clasters: Data Safety Digital Integration, Integrated Traffic Reorganization
Description: The SSML focuses on road safety enhancements through an algorithm for identifying near-miss situations and safety hazards like harsh braking and cornering. It also includes implementing traffic calming measures and promoting sustainable mobility.
name: Tampere

Thematic Clasters: Safe & Sustainable Schools, Central Areas Traffic Reorganization, Integrated Traffic Reorganization
Description: In Warsaw, with a high motorisation rate, efforts are focused on improving road safety, especially for vulnerable road users like children. The initiative aims to reclaim pedestrian space, making it safer and more appealing for all.
UMI Categories: Modal Share, Accidents & Injuries, Space Reallocation
name: Warsaw

Thematic Clasters: Central Areas Traffic Reorganization, Data Safety Digital Integration
Description: The SSML in Zagreb will target a densely populated urban area characterised by high volumes of vulnerable road users (VRUs), including pedestrians, cyclists, children, elderly individuals, and people with disabilities, alongside significant traffic congestion.
name: Zagreb
location: Unsafe intersection of Selska – Horvaćanska Street.
